fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some Assignable User Permissions allow any user to be selected in the assignee field at issue creation

Please note that this issue doesn't happen with any Assignable user Permission. For now, it has only been reproduced in the case where this permission is granted to:
- either *Group custom field value*
- or *User custom field value*

From what I observed which this type of Assignable User Configuration is that:
- on the issue creation view, the assignee field shows all users from the JIRA instance, instead of only the users who are assignable
- if we select a user who is not assignable, it is impossible to create the ticket and JIRA will complain about this user (which shows that JIRA will verify the permission AFTER the user is selected, and not BEFORE)


h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Scenario 1 (User custom field value):*

Steps:
# Create a field of type "User Picker (multiple users)""
# Go to a project setting page, click on permission
# Edit the permission to only grant the field created in step 1 the "Assignable User" permission
 !Scenario1_AssignPermission.png|thumbnail! 
# Create an issue within this project
# Select a group in the field created in step 1
# Click on the assignee field and notice that any user from the entire JIRA instance can be selected
 !Scenario1_IssueCreation1.png|thumbnail! 
# Try to click on the "Create" button and notice that JIRA is displaying an error saying that the issue can't be assigned to the selected user
 !Scenario1_IssueCreation2.png|thumbnail! 

*Scenario 2 (with Group custom field value):*

Steps:
# Create a field of type "Group Picker (single group)" or "Select List (single choice)"
# Go to a project setting page, click on permission
# Edit the permission to only grant the field created in step 1 the "Assignable User" permission
 !Scenario2_AssignPermission.png|thumbnail! 
# Create an issue within this project
# Select a group in the field created in step 1
# Click on the assignee field and notice that any user from the entire JIRA instance can be selected
 !Scenario2_IssueCreation1.png|thumbnail! 
# Try to click on the "Create" button and notice that JIRA is displaying an error saying that the issue can't be assigned to the selected user
 !Scenario2_IssueCreation2.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Actual Results

Non Assignable users are able to be selected in the assignee field, but if we create the issue, JIRA shows an error saying that the user can't be assigned the issue.

h3. Expected Results

Non assignabe users should not show up in the Assignee field.

h3. Notes

This appears to only occur during *Issue Creation*. If the issue has already been created, JIRA will not allow a non-assignable user to be set as the assignee.

h3. Workaround

There is currently no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Some Assignable User Permissions allow any user to be selected in the assignee field at issue creation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
At the moment, it's possible to create both an inward and an outward link of the same type (eg, relates to, is related to) to a single issue. This should be allowed to be restricted

h3. Suggestion
Give an option to restrict having the same link (inward and outward) to the same issue

h3. Use case
Sometimes the links will be named _is parent of_ and _is child of_, depending on the organizations need. It would then not make sense for issue A to be a parent of issue B, and at the same time is also a child of issue B
fields.summary: Restrict both inward/outward link on the same issue

fields.description:
The node id of the node you are connected to in JIRA Data Center is displayed in the footer, eg {{Atlassian JIRA Project Management Software (v7.5.1:fd8c849:i-NODEID)}}

You can write rules in your load balancer to display a node identifier in cookies, and by doing so allow people to select their node by changing the value in the cookie (a very useful tool for admins). However, the node id in the footer does not update.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a rule in your load balancer to add the node name or IP to a cookie, and use that cookie for session persistence
 # Load JIRA and make a note of the node ID in the footer
 # Confirm which node you are connected to by looking at your load balancer
 # Change the node identifier in the cookie to another node, and refresh
 # Confirm you connected to that node, by checking the load balancer
 # Check the footer
 -- Observe that the node id *has not changed* - it is still the previous node
 # Open an incognito window and load JIRA
 # Check the cookie to see which node you are connected to, and check the node id in the footer. Make a note of these.
 # Close and reopen your incognito window, so you connect to another node
 # Check the cookie to confirm you are connected to the other node
 # Check the node id in the footer, and confirm it is different, as in it corresponds to the actual node you are connected to.
 -- This is what should happen in normal browsing.
fields.summary: JIRA Data Center Node ID in the footer is cached, but it should update on connection to a different node.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Assume some node in JIRA Datacenter is executing long running task with has cluster wide status. If at some point progress abnormally stops before the job is complete, then job will be stuck for whole cluster. 
The stuck job is stored in an in-memory cache and is replicated to other nodes when they start. All nodes must be shutdown at the same time in order for this job to be removed from cache.

h3. Environment
* JIRA DataCenter with 2+ nodes

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Performs change that causes "Bulk Operation" action 
# Monitor "Bulk Operation Progress" bar. 
# Restart the node executing job (or create database connection failure)


h3. Actual Results
* Progress bar appears in stuck state on each node. 
** A restart of one node has no impact, progress bar continues to appear.
* The stuck job appears when trying to make other changes. Other changes cannot be made while this is stuck.
* All nodes must be shutdown at the same time in order for this job to be removed from cache.

h3. Expected Results
Either:
* JIRA cluster detects the job is no longer progressing, throws an error, and no longer shows the stuck "Bulk Operation Progress" bar.
*  Or JIRA cluster detects the job is no longer progressing and continues the job

In either case, a stuck job on one node _does not require restart of entire cluster_

h3. Notes
* A stuck bulk edit can be reproduced by setting a breakpoint to stop thread on {{BulkEditOperation.java}} line 184.
* The bulk edit task is in memory and is communicated to all nodes.
* Nodes will keep this task in memory until it is deleted, or all nodes are down (clearing tasks in memory)
** Task is deleted when the operation is complete. Operation happens on the node the task started on.

h3.Workaround
In some cases, it may possible to manually delete the stuck job. This should only be done after being absolutely certain that the job is no longer running. 

Example for +project migration+ and +bulk edits+ :
* This needs to be run by the user who executed the task. In addition the user must be a JIRA Administrator in order to delete the task. 
** If necessary grant temporary admin permission, delete task, then remove admin permission. 
** URL below applies to bulk edits as well as project changes
{quote}
There is a internal REST point to stop tasks.

* DELETE /rest/projectconfig/1/migrationStatus/#id
* "#id" can be taken from the progress page's URL.
{quote}
fields.summary: Bulk Operation can get stuck in JIRA Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JQL searches using {{NOT}} and {{WAS IN}} causes an Internal Server Error. There are some searches that Jira will not allow you to save as a filter as the search does not execute. But in an edge case, if you have a search calling for another filter, it's possible to save it, but you are not able to load it from _Issues > Filter Name_.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h5. Scenario 1

# Navigate to _Issues > Search for issues_ and try to search for:
{code}
project = TEST AND NOT (status was in (Done)) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}

h5. Scenario 2

# Create one filter with:
{code}
project in (AWD, AWS) AND issuetype in (bug, task, story) AND status was in ("Status 7", open, "Status 8", resolved)
{code}
# Create a second filter:
{code}
status was not Closed AND resolution was in (Duplicate, Done, Fixed) AND NOT filter = first_filter
{code}
# Go back to the Dashboard and try to open the second filter by navigating to _Issues > Filter Name_.

h3. Expected Results

You are able to load the filter without any problems.

h3. Actual Results

For the scenario 1:

You are not able to execute the search and the following error is displayed: 

{quote}
Error occurred communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again.
{quote}

For the scenario 2: 

You are not able to load the filter and get the following error page:

!Screen Shot 2017-10-24 at 16.08.07.png|thumbnail!

The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file:
{noformat}
2017-10-24 16:08:00,746 http-nio-8080-exec-7 ERROR admin 968x123x1 zfc9db 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /issues/ [o.a.c.c.C.[.[localhost].[/jira728].[action]] Servlet.service() for servlet action threw exception
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unrecognized operator: WAS_IN
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.clause.DeMorgansVisitor.getNotOperator(DeMorgansVisitor.java:132)
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.clause.DeMorgansVisitor.visit(DeMorgansVisitor.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.clause.DeMorgansVisitor.visit(DeMorgansVisitor.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.query.clause.WasClauseImpl.accept(WasClauseImpl.java:45)
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.clause.DeMorgansVisitor.visitChildren(DeMorgansVisitor.java:92)
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.clause.DeMorgansVisitor.visit(DeMorgansVisitor.java:40)
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.clause.DeMorgansVisitor.visit(DeMorgansVisitor.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.query.clause.AndClause.accept(AndClause.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.clause.DeMorgansVisitor.visit(DeMorgansVisitor.java:34)
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.clause.DeMorgansVisitor.visit(DeMorgansVisitor.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.query.clause.NotClause.accept(NotClause.java:29)
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.context.QueryContextVisitor.createContext(QueryContextVisitor.java:53)
{noformat}

h3. Notes

This bug can lead to broken boards as reported under JRASERVER-65345.


h3.Workaround

It is possible to modify the JQL as the example below:
{code}
project = TEST AND status was not Done ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}
fields.summary: Issue Search broken when using NOT with WAS IN

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+
All issues of the same issue type in the same project use the same schemes. This means, for *editmeta* REST endpoint, it's only necessary to supply project and issuetype to retrieve all the editable fields for all issues in that project and of that issue type. Permissions shouldn't matter here and should only be checked when an actual issue update is performed.

h3. +Suggestion+
Currently, [editmeta|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/issue-getEditIssueMeta] requires an issue key/ID, which is inconvenient and slows down the process. It should work in the same way as [createmeta|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/issue-getCreateIssueMeta].

If an issue key/ID must be included, please clearly document why.
fields.summary: Document why REST editmeta requires Issue Key/ID

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA doesn't display custom fields that were created from an old uninstalled plugins.
Also there is no way to remove those or access them by any mean from JIRA UI with plugin not installed.


h3. Environment
*  JIRA Server + custom fields originating from a plugin


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install the free plugin JIRA misc. custom fields
# Create a calculated custom field from JIRA custom fields page
# Create a project and integrate that field in project screens
# Uninstall the plugin


h3. Expected Results
* JIRA would continue to display the custom field in the custom fields page and user is allowed basic operations like view custom field config or delete.

h3. Actual Results
After the plugin is uninstalled, the custom field vanished form custom fields page and user no longer able remove the custom field from the UI, while the field is still existing in the database and JIRA is not able to use it causing exceptions in the logs of the like of below:
{noformat}
2017-09-12 13:20:05,125 https-jsse-nio-443-exec-9 DEBUG user1 799x47936x3 1ir2r8o 10.10.10.1 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviewconfig/editmodel.json [c.a.j.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField] getCustomFieldType potentially called on Custom Field before plugin enabled. Will retry on next call and return null from this execution
com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField$TypeNotFoundException: Custom Field Type 'com.innovalog.jmcf.jira-misc-custom-fields:transitiondatetime' not found
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
During JIRA referencing the plugin code, it will not be able to tell if plugin was uninstalled or if it was disabled temporarily.

h3.Workaround
* The easiest way to fix this is to reinstall the plugin once more and remove the custom field, then uninstall the plugin again.
* Direct database manipulation is discouraged.
fields.summary: JIRA not displaying custom fields from uninstalled plugins

fields.description:
Custom fields are often duplicated across Jira projects. While the custom fields may store the same _type_ of information, administrators often need to create duplicate custom fields with new names that are more _contextually relevant_ for a given project. As an example, one project may have a custom field called "Supervisor", while another project uses a custom field called "Manager". Both custom fields store the same type of information.

Adding the ability for administrators/project admins to use aliases for custom fields on a per-project basis would allow for the reduction of the overall number custom fields in Jira. Large numbers of custom fields are known to negatively impact performance and this would help to mitigate the need to create additional fields.

Aliases would need to be usable in JQL searches, as users of a given project are likely to only know a custom field by it's per-project alias.
fields.summary: Add the ability to create custom field aliases

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Having users with 2 spaces or more in the username field show no result when manually inserting it with @mention.

Let's say we have the following users:
user tag test A
user tag test B
user tag test C
user tag test D
user tag test E
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to an issue, at the *Comments* section select the *Comment* button.
# @mention one of the users: i.e. @user tag test, and when you insert the last part of the name (after the 2 spaces) no user is listed.

h3. Expected Results
When typing the last part of the username Jira should show the user to be selected.

h3.Solution / Workaround
There are 2 workarounds:
# Select the *Text* field in the *Comment* and search the user with [~username].
# Change the username by deleting one space (i.e. user tag test A change to user_tag test A).
fields.summary: Tagging a user with more than 2 spaces in username is not working in issue comment.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The default _None_ option is not available in the custom field configuration for multi select list

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.5.1 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field select list - multi select
# Have a few option available under the custom field you just created
# Go back to the custom field configuration, under _Edit Default value_

h3. Expected Results
The default _None_ option is available

h3. Actual Results
The default _None_ option is not available

h3. Workaround
(!) This workaround will need to be reapplied after upgrading Jira (as it edits a Velocity Template). You should ensure you have a backup of this file, and test these changes before applying to production:

# Edit {{$jira-install/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/plugins/fields/edit/edit-multiselect.vm}}
# Find the following:
{code}
#if ( !$isFrotherControl && $fieldLayoutItem && $fieldLayoutItem.required == false)
   <option value="-1"#if (!$selectedValues || $selectedValues.empty || $selectedValues.contains("-1")) selected="selected"#end>${i18n.getText('common.words.none')}</option>
#end
{code}
# Edit the {{if}} condition, so it looks like this:
{code}
#if ( !$isFrotherControl && $fieldLayoutItem.required == false)
    <option value="-1"#if (!$selectedValues || $selectedValues.empty || $selectedValues.contains("-1")) selected="selected"#end>${i18n.getText('common.words.none')}</option>
#end
{code}
# Restart Jira for the changes to take effect

(i) It's important to note that this will not affect fields that have are required. While it is possible to remove the condition entirely, doing so would negatively affect multi selects in large instances - this strikes the best balance between usability without breaking the UI.

If you select "None" that will unset the value in the database - i.e, Jira will not set it. This means that the field will not show if the value is not set, nor will that issue be found in database queries. If you need to see the "None" value explicitly set, consider adding an additional option to the custom field.

 h3. Notes
The _None_ option is showing as the default option under the Create issue screen
fields.summary: Default None option is not available under the custom field configuration for multi select list

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Unable to customize filename of the ZIP file that is created after selecting "Download All" option. Currently, all created ZIP files are named after issue key. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Implement the option to rename downloaded ZIP file after other fields' value, for example: the downloaded ZIP file would be named after issue summary.
h3. Why this is important 

Customers would track their downloaded ZIP files easily if the files would be named after some logical value (summary, for instance).
fields.summary: Ability to change "Download All" created ZIP filename

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
Apparently, some plugin would require different steps when restoring its data through JIRA usual XML Backup Restore. At the end, the import would fail with a certain error. At this point, mostly it could be restored properly if JIRA already has the Add-ons installed before the Restoration but, the Admin would not know which plugin it is.

h3. Suggested Solution:
To provide the details or some kind of report for the Add-ons that are failing at the end of the restoration would be great. It would help the admin which Add-on that needs to be taking care of and providing information to Support whether it is the Add-on Vendor or Atlassian easier.
fields.summary: Report at the end of upgrade if there is a problem in restoring Add-ons data

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a health check fails, the translated Description and Failure Reason strings are inserted into the table {{AO_2F1435_HEALTH_CHECK_STATUS}}. In some languages, the translated string can exceed the default column size.

This has been confirmed for the following languages:
# French
# Russian

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Trigger health check error with the following message
{code}
Vérifie le nombre maximum de processus (threads) que le compte d'utilisateur peut exploiter simultanément. Le nombre maximum de processus est défini par le système d'exploitation et s'il est trop faible vous risquez de vous heurter à des problèmes de performance et à des erreurs dues au manque de mémoire (OOM).
{code}

Alternatively, directly insert the following into DB
{code}
insert into dbo.AO_2F1435_HEALTH_CHECK_STATUS (STATUS_NAME,DESCRIPTION) VALUES ('test3','Vérifie le nombre maximum de processus (threads) que le compte d''utilisateur peut exploiter simultanément. Le nombre maximum de processus est défini par le système d''exploitation et s''il est trop faible vous risquez de vous heurter à des problèmes de performance et à des erreurs dues au manque de mémoire (OOM).');
{code} 

h3. Expected Behavior
JIRA is able to insert the health check error into DB. 
 
h3. Actual Behavior
The insert will fail - and the error message will vary by database type.

h3.Workaround
There is no valid workaround at this time. While it would be possible to alter the database column type (so it can accomodate a larger string) this is not the recommended approach. In Active Objects Tables, the database schema is more abstracted than traditional application tables - making adjustments directly to the schema inadvisable. If you do make changes, ensure you've got a full database backup; and that changes are tested before applying to production.
fields.summary: Database truncation error when inserting certain translated messages

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
* In Basic search, it's possible to get a complete list of fields suggested with just part of the field name.
** For example, searching with word _date_: all fields with the word _date_ in the name will be suggested.
 !image-2017-10-20-17-02-36-293.png|thumbnail! 
* In Advanced search, only fields with the beginning of the name matches the search string will be suggested.
** ** For example, searching with word _date_: only fields with field name starts with _date_ will be suggested.
 !image-2017-10-20-17-05-00-926.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
Allow searching for part of the field name in Advanced searches

h3. Why is it important
* It helps users to identify the correct field and increase the efficiency in JQL searches
fields.summary: Inconsistent suggestions for Fields between Basic and Advanced searches

fields.description:
Currently, when the Create Branch button is selected in JIRA, all of the repositories and branches that a user has access to are available.

Requested Feature:
Repositories are configurable to display the last selected repository and branch When the Create Branch button is selected inside a JIRA issue, the previously selected repository and branch are selected.
This would be very beneficial when users are creating multiple branches in a JIRA issue because the user would be more confident the correct branch in the correct repository is selected.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When performing the clone operation on a parent task that has subtasks associated with it, the cloned parent task will be created before the cloned subtasks. Deleting the cloned parent task before the entire cloning process is completed will result in the cloned subtasks that are created afterwards to have no parent task.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a parent issue (TEST-1) with a lot of subtasks (500+ in my own tests).
# Proceed to clone the issue along with its subtasks by checking the "Clone Subtasks" checkbox in the clone issue dialog.
# While the cloning is still being done, delete the Cloned parent issue.

h3. Expected Results
Either one of the following behaviors:
* The cloning operation is completed
* The deletion is blocked until the cloning is completed.
* All cloned subtasks of the cloned parent task will be deleted.
* A warning dialog will pop out to warn the user

h3. Actual Results
The cloning still continues and thus the cloned subtasks are being created without a parent issue.
fields.summary: When cloning a parent task with subtasks, deleting the cloned parent task while the cloning is ongoing will result in orphaned cloned subtasks

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The legacy "view all projects" page is slow when there are a lot of projects

h3. Environment

Jira Server Standalone with 3000 projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Click "Projects" dropdown.
# Click "View all projects" and measure the time of the page load
# Go to the legacy "view all projects page" at {{/secure/ViewProjects.jspa}} and measure the time of the page load

h3. Expected Results

The legacy page is just as fast as the new one.

h3. Actual Results

The new page (step #3) takes 1 second to load.
The legacy page (step #4) takes 12 seconds to load.

h3. Workaround

Workaround is to redirect the legacy pages
 ({{/secure/ViewProjects.jspa}}) to the new page ({{/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa?selectedCategory=all&selectedProjectType=all}}).

({{/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa}}) to the new page ({{/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa?selectedCategory=all&selectedProjectType=all}}).

The new page differs from the old one only sligthly.
UX-wise, the new page:
* has more features: filtering by type and text
* doesn't display default assignee
* is paginated

Performance-wise:
* makes a lot less {{/secure/projectavatar}} requests
* reads a lot less data about projects (including database and caches)
fields.summary: Legacy "view all projects" page is slow

fields.description:

Getting deleted worklogs via REST or Java API fails (usually times out) if there're too many worklogs to be retrieved.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

{code}/rest/api/2/worklog/deleted?since=timestamp{code}

or this [Java API method|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/8.2.1/com/atlassian/jira/issue/worklog/WorklogManager.html#getWorklogsDeletedSince-java.lang.Long-]:
{code}List<DeletedWorklog> getWorklogsDeletedSince(Long sinceInMilliseconds){code}

h3. Expected Results
The results are quickly retrieved

h3. Actual Results
Jira keeps processing the request and then times out
 
h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: JIRA Performance is bad to get deleted worklogs

!search.png|thumbnail!
h2. Suggestion

It would be better if you will be directed to the login page instead of the warning message. There's a Knowledge base article published to force JIRA to direct the users to the login page but it's no longer working in a newer JIRA versions (tested on 7.2.3, 7.4 and 7.5)

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

* When using a password like with characters like '#μX)!]@-}' the login to the database fails in PostgreSQL 9.3 and 9.6.


h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Configure JIRA to use a PostgreSQL database, having a user with a password containing special characters.
 

h5. Expected Behavior
* JIRA Starts and it makes a successful login 
 

h5. Actual Behavior
* We receive a login failed error: {code}2017-10-19 17:26:31,333 JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR      [c.a.config.bootstrap.DefaultAtlassianBootstrapManager] Could not successfully test your database: 
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: password authentication failed for user "jirauser"
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.ConnectionFactoryImpl.doAuthentication(ConnectionFactoryImpl.java:443)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.ConnectionFactoryImpl.openConnectionImpl(ConnectionFactoryImpl.java:217){code}

h5. Cause
* Unknown.

h5. Workaround
* Not using any special characters in the password
* To use another database option.

h5. Notes
* A similar issue was present before and was fixed in: [JRASERVER-27796|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27796] although this time the issue is specific to PostgreSQL I tested in MySQL 5.7 and the issue is not present.
fields.summary: Database Login fails when using special characters in the password in PostgreSQL 9.3 and 9.6

fields.description: h3. +Summary+ When linking a JIRA issue with an external web page using Web Link, JIRA makes a request to get the favicon of the web page and embed it using tag in the page source. This will stop JIRA from requesting the favicon from the external web page every time the page is loaded.

fields.description:
h3. +Problem+

In [Running JIRA applications over SSL or HTTPS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/running-jira-applications-over-ssl-or-https-935391761.html], under Command Line Installation -> Step 2. Update Tomcat with the KeyStore, the example config uses {{sslProtocol}} incorrectly:
{code:java}
<Connector port="8443" protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol"
              maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" SSLEnabled="true"
              maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25"
              enableLookups="false" disableUploadTimeout="true"
              acceptCount="100" scheme="https" secure="true"
              sslEnabledProtocols="TLSv1.2,TLSv1.3"
              clientAuth="false" sslProtocol="TLSv1.2,TLSv1.3" useBodyEncodingForURI="true"
              keyAlias="jira" keystoreFile="<JIRA_HOME>/jira.jks" keystorePass="changeit" keystoreType="JKS"/>
{code}
(i) This attribute shouldn't accept multiple values.

(!) Configuring as above makes the Connector fail to start: [JIRA's Tomcat SSL Connector fails to start with SSLContext not available|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA%27s+Tomcat+SSL+Connector+fails+to+start+with+SSLContext+not+available].
h3. +Suggested Fix+

{{sslProtocol}} is not necessary and should be removed from the example. Using only {{sslEnabledProtocols}} is good enough.
fields.summary: Documentation regarding configuring SSL uses wrong attribute in example config

h3. Summary
Using the expand issue function will trigger the loss of a pending comment despite following the warning popup instructions to cancel the operation.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.5.0
** Software Project
** Business Project 
* Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a project
# Click the Issues navigation item in the sidebar for the project
# Type a draft comment but do not submit it
# Click the expand issue icon in the top right of the issue pain
# Click cancel when warned that the comment draft will be lost

h3. Expected Results
The pop clears and you can continue to edit your comment.

h3. Actual Results
A second instance of the popup appears, if you click cancel or ok, the issue pain expands and only the collapse button is rendered.  The comment is lost.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There is a feature to [create linked issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver038/linking-issues-935909826.html] that allow user to choose which project and issue type but must be done in a manual way. Moreover, the create linked issue screen is not available to be select in the workflow transition.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if there is an appropriate transition to display the screen "Create a linked issue" for use to choose. For example:
 !create-linked-issues-screen.png|thumbnail!
h3. Note

By default, JIRA is not able to add project fields in a screen except create issue screen.
fields.summary: Ability to add Create Linked Issues screen in workflow transition

fields.description:
Currently, after an issue is created, if a user clicks on the Reporter and starts writing (assuming the user has the correct permissions to allow changing the reporter of the issue and to browse users) a list with the possible users appears, but this list actually contains all users in JIRA, even the ones that are not included in the _Browse Project_ or _Assignable Users_ permissions which can lead to incorrect users set as Reporters, and also this reporters being unable to actually see the issue. This behavior can easily be perceived as counter-intuitive.

The suggestions are as follows (can be any of them, as long as there is a way to control the behavior):
 * Make the possible users (that can be set as Reporter) restricted by the _Browse Project_ permission (which seems to be the most logical option).
 * Create a new permission (either project or global level) to set rules to the users that can be set as Reporters.
 * Keep the current behavior but show a message indicating if the user does not have the required permissions to see the issue.
fields.summary: Add a way to configure which users can be set as Reporters

fields.description:
There are several scenarios where user's username and email are shown. This can be considered a security risk for some customers.

Examples:
 * When doing a user search, a suggestion list appears while writing, this list includes the user display name, email and even username.
 * From the issue view, any user can see another user's profile, which shows all the information of the user.

Similarly suggested for Confluence, the suggestion is allowing a way to control the access to this information (like only showing display names for non-admin users) or using the following as an example:

1. A user is only allowed to see the name and profile of another user if they are in the same group. (at least one group, not all)

2. Allow a global administrative option for enabling/disabling user names and profiles.

3. Allow each user to decide whether their username, email and/or profile should be viewable.
fields.summary: As an admin, allow me configuring what user's information is shared between users

fields.description:
Recently this was fixed to have exports recognize a limit:
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63239

The problem is that if users simply do a search that returns more than the max limit, they'll hit an error with no details on how to workaround the problem.

In the past, before JIRA 7, the exports would by default set tempMax to be 1000. But with the new exports, the default does not have a limit, so users will commonly run into the forbidden error.

With that, issue exports should do the following:
 # Automatically have the tempMax parameter set as default to match the max limit
 # Provide instructions on how to change the tempMax limit.

Example of error: 
 !Export Error.png|thumbnail!
h5. Workaround
 # Append the URL with {{&tempMax=1000}}

(i) Check an example script at https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/exporting-jira-s-issues-using-csv-in-batches-1071829731.html
fields.summary: Issue Exports Should Default to the Max Limit

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Reopening IndexReader may lead to memory leak and causing additional pressure on JVM this may.

Error:
{noformat}
Error while resetting searcher: ISSUE message: this IndexReader is closed
org.apache.lucene.store.AlreadyClosedException: this IndexReader is closed
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader.ensureOpen(IndexReader.java:263)
{noformat}
or this line is present it the logs
{noformat}
"Tried to reopen the IndexReader, but it threw AlreadyClosedException. Opening a fresh IndexReader."{noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

This is not guaranteed to reproduce the bug.
 # Run background reindex 
 # Do many search requests

h3. Expected Results

Jira handles reopen of IndexReader gracefully. 
h3. Actual Results

After one of the above two errors happen Jira is opening another fresh copy of IndexReader from disk. This result in all Lucene memory caches being duplicated. In most cases those structures occupy several GB or RAM which results in either OutOfMemoryError or memory pressure and full GC events being triggered. 
h3. Notes
This is happening because of concurrency bug in com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseable.Helper

Example of leak in *DelayCloseSearcher*"
 !DelayCloseSearcher_leak.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Restart JIRA
fields.summary: Reopening IndexReader may lead to memory leak

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

According to current documentations:
 * [Cache.put|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-cache-api/2.0.7/atlassian-cache-api/apidocs/com/atlassian/cache/Cache.html#put(K, V)]:
{quote}Put an object into the cache. If the specified key already exists within the cache, it will be replaced by the new object.

*NOTE:* Users of caches that wish to be well behaved in a clustered environment should use the [{{CacheLoader}}|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-cache-api/2.0.7/atlassian-cache-api/apidocs/com/atlassian/cache/CacheLoader.html] semantics and supply a [{{CacheLoader}}|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-cache-api/2.0.7/atlassian-cache-api/apidocs/com/atlassian/cache/CacheLoader.html] when getting the [{{Cache}}|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-cache-api/2.0.7/atlassian-cache-api/apidocs/com/atlassian/cache/Cache.html].
{quote}
 * [CacheSettingsBuilder.replicateViaCopy|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-cache-api/2.0.7/atlassian-cache-api/apidocs/com/atlassian/cache/CacheSettingsBuilder.html#replicateViaCopy()]
{quote}Indicates that in a clustered environment with replicated caches, this cache should replicate put and update operations by copying the relevant key and value across the wire (requiring both of them to be [{{Serializable}}|http://java.sun.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/io/Serializable.html?is-external=true]). By default, put and update operations are replicated by sending only the key across the wire, for invalidation by the other nodes in the cluster; this requires only the key to be [{{Serializable}}|http://java.sun.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/io/Serializable.html?is-external=true].
{quote}

it's not clear whether {{CacheLoader}} and  {{replicateViaCopy}} work together. One may expect that once cache is loaded in one JIRA Data Center node using a {{CacheLoader}}, it can be replicated to the other nodes using {{replicateViaCopy}}. E.g.:
{code:java}
Cache<Integer, Integer> cache = cacheManager.getCache(MyPluginComponentImpl.class.getName() + ".cache", new ComponentCacheLoader(),
new CacheSettingsBuilder().remote().replicateViaCopy().replicateSynchronously().build());{code}
(!) However this is not the case because {{CacheLoader}} ignores {{replicateViaCopy}}.
h3. +Suggestion+

Update the documentations so that it's clear only either {{CacheLoader}} or {{replicateViaCopy}} should be implemented.

(+) It's suggested to use {{CacheLoader}} rather than {{replicateViaCopy}} because, for replication, old caches won't be replicated when a node is restarted.
fields.summary: Clarification on the usage of CacheLoader and replicateViaCopy

fields.description:
Hello,

Please, make it possible to export issues lists as CSV with UTF-8 encoding.

It should be quite simple by adding *byte order mark* (*BOM*) to result file before actual CSV output. 

It may be another CSV export option in menu  like "export  as CSV (UTF-8)" 

or with option allowing to chose simple text CSV  or UTF-8.

BR VaidaS K.
h3. Workarounds

* Following this forces Excel to correctly interpret the characters:
*# In Excel, go to the _Data_ section, and select the option *From Text/CSV* (should appear on the let part of the panel).
*# Select the CSV file.
*# In the emergent window, select the File Orifin _Unicode (UTF-8)_ (see my example [^image-2018-03-07-17-38-26-848.png]).
*# Click on the Load button.
** This should allow Excel to correctly display the Chinese characters (see example [^image-2018-03-07-17-43-09-156.png]]
* Another workaround would be to use the Export to HTML and open the file directly with Excel, and the characters are displayed correctly.
* You could use a script to insert the BOM in the CSV like the following python script, kindly shared by one of our Jira users:
{code:java}
import sys
import os

f = open(sys.argv[1], "rb")
data = f.read()
f.close()

head, tail = os.path.split(sys.argv[1])

f = open(os.path.join(head, "bom-" + tail), "wb")
f.write(bytearray([239, 187, 191]))
f.write(data)
f.close(){code}
fields.summary: "byte order mark (BOM)" option for CSV export

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Users without Bulk Change global permission are not able to perform any bulk operations via the Issue Navigator. However, on an issue with sub-tasks available, users are given the option to perform a bulk operation for sub-tasks which will eventually lead them to an error page.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
# As an admin, revoke the Bulk Change global permission from non-admin users.
# Create an issue and a sub-task for the issue.
# As a non-admin user, view the parent issue created in step 2.
# On the Sub-tasks panel of the parent issue, click to view the menu > Bulk operation.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected result
The non-admin user shouldn't be able to see the option of Bulk operation.

h3. Actual result
The non-admin user is able to see the option of Bulk operation, click on it to select the operation. However, it will not be completed as it will lead the user to an error page.
fields.summary: Users without Bulk Change global permission are offered an option to perform bulk operation via issue's Sub-tasks panel

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Prior to JIRA 7, it was possible to search for users by individual attributes:
* Username
* Email
* Display Name

This allowed administrators to filter on multiple fields with different values. Such as username John and email address like example.com which is extremely helpful in large installations.

In JIRA 7 all fields were combined into a single search field that does an OR on all attributes.  This cleaned up the UI, but made it impossible to search effectively on multiple fields.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add an advanced area that allows searching the individual attributes again as an AND search

h3. Workaround

* Search directly in the database by querying the *{{cwd_user}}* table.
* Use a 3rd party add-on such as [User Management for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.techtime.jira.plugins.usermanagement/server/overview]
fields.summary: Ability to search users in User Management -> Users by individual attribute (username, email, display name)

fields.description:
h3. Environment
JIRA 7.2.3
Bitbucket 5.4.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create an application link between JIRA 7.2.3 and Bitbucket 5.1.2
Observe that the Version listed for the linked Bitbucket instance is 5.1.2
Upgrade Bitbucket to 5.4.0
Navigate to application link configuration page in JIRA
Observe that the Version listed for the linked Bitbucket instance is still reflected as 5.1.2

h3. Expected Results

When application link status is polled by JIRA, the linked application version would be updated.

h3. Actual Results

The linked application version is still reported as the old version


h3.Workaround
Remove and recreate the application link. The new application version will be reflected properly.  This does require users to regenerate OAuth tokens which may have a negative impact on user experience.
fields.summary: Linked application version is does not change when application is updated

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA only comes with 2 default validators out-of-the-box:
- Permission validator: this validator is used to prevent a user from starting a transition if they don't have the right permission
- User Permission validator: this validator is obsolete as it's a leftover from older versions of JIRA. It is mainly here for the users who were using it in older versions, and still need it.

It would be great is we could add a validator that allows to compare 2 user picker fields, for example the reporter and the approver.

h3. Workaround

The 3rd party plugin [ScriptRunner for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner/cloud/overview] might help do the comparison. According to one of the comment at the end of this [documentation|https://scriptrunner.adaptavist.com/4.3.4/jira/recipes/workflow/validators/simple-scripted-validators.html], there seems to be a way to compare 2 user picker fields (please refer to the comment from Shawn Plummer).
fields.summary: Add a workflow validator that allows to compare 2 user picker fields

fields.description:
JIRA embeds Log4j 1.2.x that has a bug which can prevent the logs to rotate properly on a Windows Server due to intensive logging activity.

h3. Expected results

JIRA handles the log rotation no matter the amount of DEBUGs that are enabled.

h3. Actual results

If there are too many DEBUGs or exceptions generating logs, the application fails to rotate the logs and can generate big files in the _JIRA-HOME_ directory.

h3. Additional Notes:

* Log4j bug: https://bz.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=29726
fields.summary: Log rotation can fail on Windows Server

fields.description: When creating a new project and using the "create with shared configuration", can Roles be included as a shared configuration?  This would save time by eliminating the extra step to setup each project's roles.
fields.summary: Create with shared configuration - template

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Admins would like to more control over user's issue transition powers.
Use case example: Assignee not allowed to transition issues to "Investigation" status if the assignee has existing issues in "Investigation" status.

h2. Suggestion
Implement additional transition conditions such as limiting transition if there's a certain number of issues in similar status.
fields.summary: Conditions for Issue Transition

fields.description:
h4. Summary

When Jira is linked to Bitbucket Server 5.4, in a Jira ticket, when you open the Commits window from the Development pane, and then click Files on the right of the list, the File link leads to the wrong Bitbucket URL -- which then leads to a 404 page on Bitbucket Server

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect Jira to Bitbucket Server 5.4.x
# Create a new repo, then add a file and commit the file into the Bitbucket repo -- with commit message containing a Jira Issue Number
# Then on the linked Jira ticket -- on the development panel, open up the Commits window
# On the commits window, on the right side of the commit, click the File link -- that should show the file which was committed to the Bitbucket repo
# Click the file name

h4. Expected Results
The File Link on the Jira Development Panel should link to the file on Bitbucket Server

h4. Actual Results.
The File Link on the Jira Development Panel linked to the wrong Bitbucket Server URL -- which leads to a 404 on Bitbucket Server

h4. Workaround
None known 

 !Screen Shot 2017-10-11 at 7.04.40 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: File link on Development Panel leads to a 404 error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

An external gadget added on a DC node isn't being picked up by other nodes until a cache flush or restart.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect directly to a DC node and add an external gadget via the *Manage Gadgets* page (/plugins/servlet/gadgets/admin).
 # Connect directly to another DC node and observe that the added gadget doesn't show in the *Gadget Directory* or on the *Manage Gadgets* page.

h3. Expected Results

An added gadget should be visible across nodes.
h3. Actual Results

The gadget is only available on the node to which it was added. It appears as though adding a gadget isn't invalidating a cache. Manually flushing caches or restarting nodes resolves the issue.
h3. Workarounds
 * Restarting nodes on which the added gadget(s) aren't visible should resolve the issue.

 * Manually flushing caches, one means being via [ScriptRunner|https://scriptrunner.adaptavist.com/5.1.6/jira/builtin-scripts.html#_clear_jira_or_groovy_caches], should resolve the issue.
fields.summary: In DC, an external gadget added to one node isn't being picked up on other nodes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
{{CachingTaggingAvatarStore}} is doing a removal (and thus a replicated event) on every read request. 


From Chris Fuller comment on this [Answers thread|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/43566119/what-jira-operations-cause-synchronous-activity-in-rmisynchronouscachereplicator], we have a piece of code we can make it better (point 2).

{quote}
Chris Fuller Oct 25, 2016

This particular cache is doing a removal (and thus a replicated event) on every read request, which is just plain dumb.  
com.atlassian.jira.avatar.CachingTaggingAvatarStore#getByIdTagged
{code:java}
@Override
public Avatar getByIdTagged(final Long avatarId) {
    try {
        return taggedAvatars.get(avatarId, () -> tagAndRetrieve(avatarId)).orElse(null);
    } finally {
        avatars.remove(avatarId);
    }
}
{code}
 
That `remove` probably isn't necessary at all.  The point is that once an avatar is "tagged" with the metadata that confirms it came from JIRA, we don't need to hold onto the untagged version of it anymore.  But on a cache hit, that untagged one is already gone, so the remove on the untagged avatar is just wasteful.  It could be moved inside the loading function or possibly removed altogether, depending on what the surrounding code does (I didn't dig in further than that).
{quote} 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Load URL: /secure/projectavatar?pid=<P_ID>&avatarId=<A_ID>

h3. Expected Results
{{com.atlassian.jira.avatar.CachingTaggingAvatarStore.getByIdTagged}} should not perform removal (and thus a replicated event) on every read request.

h3. Actual Results
{{com.atlassian.jira.avatar.CachingTaggingAvatarStore.getByIdTagged}} removes _avatarId_ from {{avatars}} cache on every read. 
 
Thread dumps from customer instances have shown where multiple threads are waiting on cache replication resulting from {{getByIdTagged}} > {{ehcache.Cache.remove}}. Example stacktrace: 
{noformat}
"http-nio-8080-exec-371 url:/secure/projectavatar username:user1 " #89237 daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007f44e0066000 nid=0x1a86f waiting on condition [0x00007f4eb5929000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00007f56bcc7b2d8> (a java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$Signaller)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider.waitForAll(JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider.java:95)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider.listRemoteCachePeers(JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider.java:63)
...
	at net.sf.ehcache.constructs.EhcacheDecoratorAdapter.remove(EhcacheDecoratorAdapter.java:155)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.remove(LoadingCache.java:208)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.remove(DelegatingCache.java:137)
	at com.atlassian.jira.avatar.CachingTaggingAvatarStore.getByIdTagged(CachingTaggingAvatarStore.java:107)
	at com.atlassian.jira.avatar.AvatarManagerImpl.getByIdTagged(AvatarManagerImpl.java:104)
...
 Locked ownable synchronizers:
	- <0x00007f5134a83a00> (a java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker)
	- <0x00007f5194be96b0> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$NonfairSync)
{noformat}

h3. Notes
Also please note, since _avatarId_ is removed from {{avatars}} cache it will take some time to populate it back and also all threads which need it will wait for data. 

Thread dumps from customer instances have shown where 6 threads are waiting on cache population:
{noformat}
"http-nio-8080-exec-280 url:/secure/QuickCreateIssue!...a username:user2 " #69636 daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007f4434086800 nid=0x1ce2f waiting on condition [0x00007f4ec3214000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00007f5194be96b0> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$NonfairSync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:836)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.doAcquireShared(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:967)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireShared(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1283)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$ReadLock.lock(ReentrantReadWriteLock.java:727)
	at net.sf.ehcache.concurrent.ReadWriteLockSync.lock(ReadWriteLockSync.java:50)
	at net.sf.ehcache.constructs.blocking.BlockingCache.acquiredLockForKey(BlockingCache.java:196)
	at net.sf.ehcache.constructs.blocking.BlockingCache.get(BlockingCache.java:158)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.get(LoadingCache.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:99)
	at com.atlassian.jira.avatar.CachingTaggingAvatarStore.getById(CachingTaggingAvatarStore.java:99)
	at com.atlassian.jira.avatar.AvatarManagerImpl.getById(AvatarManagerImpl.java:99)
	at com.atlassian.jira.project.ProjectImpl.getAvatar(ProjectImpl.java:132)
...
{noformat}
Note threads are waiting for {{CachingTaggingAvatarStore.getById}}

Also note that following Jira actions will trigger massive amount of {{/secure/projectavatar}} calls:
* /secure/ViewProjects.jspa
* /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: CachingTaggingAvatarStore.getByIdTagged performs unnecessary deletion from the cache

fields.description:
h4. Diagnosis:

When setting up a fresh install of JIRA, if certain options are selected (see replication steps in summary) such as "set it up myself" in the install wizard and then select the built in database option, upon completion of the set up, the admin will be redirected to the post upgrade landing page before being able to navigate onto the dashboard. 
h4. Summary:
 * At the beginning of the set up process for a fresh install of JIRA, you are given 2 choices "Set it up for me" and "Set it up myself". If the "Set it up myself" option is selected, you are then given the option to select a database setup on the next screen. 

!Screen Shot 2017-10-09 at 7.27.17 PM.png|width=479,height=92!

 
 * On this following screen, select the option to use a "Built in (for demonstration purposes)" database.

  !Screen Shot 2017-10-09 at 7.30.29 PM.png|width=390,height=151!

 

 
 * After this, follow the steps required by the wizard to complete the installation. Upon completion you will be redirected to the Post upgrade landing page.

!Screen Shot 2017-10-11 at 1.27.04 PM.png|width=932,height=634!
h4. Workaround:

Upon landing on the Post upgrade landing page, to navigate to the dashboard, click the "Take me to JIRA" button in the centre of the page.
fields.summary: Post upgrade landing page is displayed on some fresh installs of JIRA

fields.description:
When an email thread is added to JIRA, all users on the thread are added to the CC list in the JIRA Ticket.

And, if someone comments in the JIRA Ticket, they're added to the Ticket's CC list automatically.

However, if someone on the email thread is added later (eg someone +foo to it) then that person isn't added to the JIRA Ticket's CC list.

This would allow a much more seamless experience particularly for managers, PMOs, etc.
fields.summary: Allow cc via email to existing issue

fields.description:
Currently, if a user has the Schedule an Issue permission, [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver075/scheduling-an-issue-935563112.html], they have the rights to both set a due date, and, despite the documentation not saying so, rank an issue on a JRIA Softward board.  I need to allow our product team to set priority of an issue, without being able to say when it's due (they abuse the right to set due dates and often set arbirary dates). 

These two permissions should be decoupled, or at least documented in the above page.

 

Background for reqeust: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Rank-Issues-without-Schedule-Permission/qaq-p/652882
fields.summary: Rank Issues without Schedule Permission

fields.description:
When updating tickets with minor changes, we don't want to spam all watchers on the issue. Especially when we only fix a typo in the description as an example.

 

When working in Confluence, we can easily tick off "Notify Watchers", when we know we have made small changes to a page that does not need to be notified to the watchers.

The current workaround is to simplify the notification schemes, but that will lead to important notifications not being sent also.
fields.summary: Implement a checkbox for "Notify Watcher" when updating issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, as stated in [Delete a Project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/defining-a-project-935391062.html#Definingaproject-Deleteaproject]:
{quote}Deleting a project will only delete the issues, versions and components associated with the project. It won't delete any of the associated schemes, workflows or issues types, or any content that could be shared with another project.
{quote}
This means after deleting a bulk of projects, Administrator has to go through all the Schemes in JIRA to make sure all the unused Schemes has been removed from the instance.
h3. Suggested Solution

The only reason why the Schemes are NOT being deleted during Project Deletion is that the Schemes could be used by another Project.

*It would be better if we have a verification during Project Deletion to check if the Schemes are being used by any other Projects.*
 * If yes, then just continue the process as it is.
 * *If no, then prompt another dialog to the Administrator to mentioned that these are the Schemes that will be the orphan Schemes after Project Deletion and would the Administrator wants to delete the Schemes during the Project Deletion.*

It also will be good if JRASERVER-64878 get implemented, which will reduce an Administrator job to clean JIRA data. Or allow Administrator to bulk delete schemes as per JRASERVER-41977.
fields.summary: Deleting a project should delete the schemes if they are unused

fields.description: At the moment, when viewing an issue in JIRA, if you click on the Description field to edit it (with Wiki-style renderer), the text will disappear for a moment showing an empty field, and a moment later it will show the text back. This moment it takes to show the text, looks bad, as it is perceived as if JIRA was responding slowly, when in reality there is no apparent reason for it. If you click and immediately start writing, the blink is almost or not perceived at all, as it appears that writing 'overrides' the 'blink'.  This behavior is not present with the Default Text renderer.
fields.summary: Change the behavior of the Edition on the Description field with Wiki-style renderer

fields.description:
When using the [Anonymizer tool|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/anonymising-jira-application-data-861253848.html], the usernames, the names, last names, emails and passwords of the users are not anonymized. 

The suggestion is to include a parameter to indicate the tool to replace those values with a generic text like 'name of user', 'fakemail@fakemail.com' for email, the generic *sphere* for passwords (which is already suggested as part of the KB [Retrieving the JIRA Administrator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/retrieving-the-jira-administrator-192836.html]), support teams rarely need this information and it is sensitive data when the customer has his own customer's information in it. This improves customer's security as well as their confidence in Atlassian.
fields.summary: Increase anonymity level when using the Anonymizer tool

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to copy paste lines from Microsoft Outlook/Word into a JIRA comment field in Internet Explorer 11, there will be extra blank lines added in between.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy a text snippet from Microsoft Outlook/Word that contains multiple lines eg:
{quote}# Line A
# Line B
# Line C{quote}
# Paste it into a JIRA Comment field in IE11.

h3. Expected Results
The text snippet will be added and saved as:
{quote}# Line A
# Line B
# Line C{quote}

h3. Actual Results
The text snippet will be added and saved as:
{quote}# Line A

# Line B

# Line C{quote}

 
h3. Notes
Not reproducible with JIRA Cloud, Mozilla Firefox, Microsoft Edge and Google Chrome
fields.summary: Copy and Pasting from Outlook and Microsoft Word into the JIRA comment field in IE11 will result in additional blank lines

fields.description:
When the wiki-style rendering is active, it includes several functions:
- Displaying image thumbnails.
- Detecting email addresses: emails are shown as a link and a small 'envelope' icon is shown at the end of it.
- Detecting attached files: attached files that are mentioned using the "[^filename]" format, are shown as a link and a small 'green arrow' icon at the end.

Some customers do not require or might be even bothered by the icons shown at the end as attached files in their notifications At the moment it is not possible to just disable a part of the wiki-rendering style, so if a customer wants thumbnails included but not the icons, they have to choose between extra attachments in their notifications (the wiki-style icons are added as attachments) or disabling the wiki-style rendering entirely (worst case scenario is sending text notifications instead of HTML, which defeats the whole purpose).

The suggestion is to allow Email notifications to be configured to NOT include the icons added from the wiki-style rendering or allow configuring the Wiki-style rendering to not include the icons at all.
fields.summary: Increase Emails Notifications flexibility to allow removing wiki-style rendering icons from notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

* JIRA keeps using the same TCP connections during subsequent LDAP requests
* The same TCP connection is reused no matter if it is for the same or different users
* After single failed connection attempt JIRA does not make a retry
* The next manual connection attempt is always successful (a fresh TCP connection is used)

This causes problem for environment where internal network switch/firewall terminates TCP connections after "X" minutes of inactivity

The same problem does not happen with Confluence. It looks like Confluence creates a new TCP connection for every new LDAP query.


h3. Suggested Solution

# Rewrite JIRA LDAP code by reusing existing Confluence code modules.
# Add single “retry” to connecting to LDAP routine.


h3. Workaround 

When the TCP packet is terminated, login to JIRA manually again.
fields.summary: Improve JIRA's LDAP connectivity

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a user has several user accounts on his JIRA with similar names, for example, lots of users with surname "Xu", he struggles to find users on Reporter's user-picker dropdown search field as the field shows "Showing 20 of 120 matching users" but scrolling down to see users past the first twenty nothing happens. Searching for the user's name, username or e-mail doesn't have any effect at all and the field still shows only the first matching users and doesn't allow to scroll down further.
h3. How to reproduce

The instance has 120 users with "Xu" as a surname, for example. You want to find the user the user "Xu Xu", username "xu.xu", e-mail "xu.xu@test.com".
 # Go to any issue, click to choose a Reporter
 # Write "Xu Xu" > It will filter all 120 users that have their surname Xu, instead of the specific user. The user can't scroll down to find the correct user as "Xu Xu" is in the 117th position of the search, and the list only show the first 20.
 # Write "xu.xu", the same behaviour happens
 # Write "xu.xu@test.com", same behaviour happens

h3. Workaround

The workaround on this case is to type the user's username "xu.xu" and click outside, anywhere out of the dropdown list. It will select the correct user then.

 *{color:#ff0000}(!) NOTE:{color}* Workaround for Jira Software and Jira Core only - Does not apply to Jira Service Desk. In Service Desk, the users can be added to the request via "Share" request.
fields.summary: Unable to find user account on Reporter's user-picker field through his name/username/e-mail when there are a lot of users with similar names

fields.description:
In the last couple of weeks, UPM/Marketplace has been experiencing a problem that didn't allow users to download new or upgrade existing software inside JIRA. This has caused several issues because customers had tried to upgrade their instances without knowing a problem was happening.

If an alert would have been shown inside JIRA, like a warning pop-up, informing that the problem was happening, customers could have waited for a fix before trying to upgrade their systems, potentially saving several hours of rollbacks or other workarounds.

In short, as a JIRA Administrator, i would like to be alerted inside JIRA when there are any issues with UPM and or the Marketplace.

 

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66050
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator, i would like to be alerted inside JIRA when there are issues with UPM and/or the Marketplace

fields.description:
With monitors with a resolution of 1440x900 and below, dialogs like the "Create Issue" dialog do not resize properly when the browser window is resized to half of the screen's width (using Window's "snap" feature). This seems to be the case for all "create issue dialogs" in JIRA.

It would be good to make elements like this more responsive in JIRA.

Even adding a horizontal scrollbar when the width of the dialog exceeds the width of the screen would make this much better.
fields.summary: Make AUI dialogs resize properly for low resolutions

fields.description:
h5. Problem

When defining the paths in {{cluster.properties}}, JIRA does not trim trailing spaces when reading. This can result in confusion as the paths look correct, but JIRA is not able to access existing applications, index snapshots, etc.
 * Note that this differs from other files like the {{jira-application.properties}}, where JIRA does trim trailing spaces

h5. Steps to Reproduce
 * Setup JIRA Data Center with 2 nodes
 * For one node, modifying the {{cluster.properties}}, add an extra space at the end of the path for {{jira.shared.home}}
 * Save, complete JDC setup
 * Add attachments to node 1
 * Now access node 2 and notice that the attachment is unavailable.

h5. Expected Behaviour

Similar to the {{jira-application.properties}}, JIRA should trim trailing white spaces
h5. Actual Results

Nodes are using different shared home paths, thus they are unable to access data from the shared home that other nodes have stored.
 * You'll also notice the extra space in startup following in startup:
{code:java}
         Attachment Path                               : /Users/dchan/atlassian/jira728dc/shared-home /data/attachments
{code}

h5. Other notes

You'll also see multiple shared home folders:
{code:java}
$ ll
total 518912
drwxr-xr-x   7 dchan  staff   238B Oct  5 09:36 .
drwxr-xr-x  66 dchan  staff   2.2K Oct  4 07:58 ..
-rw-r--r--@  1 dchan  staff   253M May 10 09:39 atlassian-jira-software-7.2.8.tar.gz
drwxr-xr-x@ 17 dchan  staff   578B May 10 09:40 jira728node1
drwxr-xr-x@ 19 dchan  staff   646B May 10 10:24 jira728node2
drwxr-xr-x  10 dchan  staff   340B Aug 31 10:20 shared-home
drwxr-xr-x   9 dchan  staff   306B Oct  5 09:38 shared-home
jira728dc$ cd shared-home
shared-home/  shared-home /
{code}
h5. Workaround

Check config file and delete spaces
fields.summary: cluster.properties does not trim trailing white space in paths

fields.description: My client asked me to change an epic to another issue type. Under this Epic are more than 100 issue types.  When I change the Epic to the new issue type I lose all the issues under it. So I want to link those issues to the new issue type. Unfortunately there is no bulk change option to do this for all those issues.
fields.summary: Bulk change issue link
